thread.title: QPR footie star Steven Caulker arrested and fined for drunkenly throwing objects around London train station
thread.title_full: QPR footie star Steven Caulker arrested and fined for drunkenly throwing objects around London train station

author: esanger
title: QPR footie star Steven Caulker arrested and fined for drunkenly throwing objects around London train station
text:
ACE BOOZE SHAME QPR footie star Steven Caulker arrested and fined for drunkenly throwing objects around London train station 
Defender was reported to be trying to hit people and even attempted to place a temporary barrier on someone's head Exclusive Comments FOOTBALLER Steven Caulker was arrested after drunkenly hurling objects in a railway station rampage. 
The 25-year-old QPR defender, reported to earn £40,000 a week, was trying to hit people — and even tried to place a temporary barrier on someone’s head. BPI 3 Steven Caulker was arrested after hurling things around a train station in a drunken rampage 
Police were called to Clapham Junction Station in South West London at 12.40am on January 16 and arrested him. 
This week Caulker, who has played for England, pleaded guilty at Wimbledon magistrates’ court to being drunk and disorderly. PA:Press Association Steven Caulker reportedly earns £40k a week QPR fan getting knocked out by a Birmingham fan Related stories QPR defender Steven Caulker joins Lokomotiv Moscow in shock loan switch in tim we trust Tim Sherwood set to replace axed Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink as QPR manager within the next 24 hours Pul is the man West Brom manager Tony Pulis being monitored by Queens Park Rangers over his future FIVE THINGS Eden Hazard‘s Maradona moment, Theo Walcott lacks a football brain and Hector Bellerin wasn't fouled They're back! Warbury Warriors are back in action in League One - before they leave to join the World Football League 'THE CANCER ATE AWAY AT MY SPINE' Footballer who had a broken neck for three months is told his 'muscle pain' is cancer ADRIAN DURHAM Jose is chained up in his dark football dungeon... it's like LVG never left Man Utd 3 LIONS AND EU FLAG EU demands England football team add its blue and gold flag to shirts alongside three lions Sunday Premier League match preview featuring Leicester v Man Utd 
Prosecutor Mary Atere said: “Officers were responding to reports that the defendant was throwing objects around, trying to hit members of the public.” 
The court heard Caulker had been fined in 2011 for a public order offence and had a caution for a similar offence. PA:Press Association 3 QPR star Caulker has been fined and cautioned for similar offences in the past 
Magistrate Elizabeth Hopper told him: “It’s the third time you have been in trouble for doing things out in the street you should not be doing.” 
Caulker, of Richmond, South West London, was fined £650 and ordered to pay £85 costs. Watch all the Premier League action from Saturday in our Daily Round-Up
